pullRequest.title: System program management service to ensure system programs are working as expected
pullRequest.bodyText:
Monitoring system programs at regular interval to ensure enabled system programs(services) are running.
Stops the services that are currently not enabled
Stops older runs if there are more than one run for enabled services.

nodes.bodyText: Usually the unit is in the config name. E.g. system.program.scan.interval.seconds

Please override the executor() method to use daemon thread and the shutdown method for executor termination.
Alternative, you can extend from the AbstractRetryableScheduledService instead. It uses daemon thread, and handle failure retries and logging.
Is the Map<String, String> the runtime arguments? If it is, you need to copy the map as well. Better yet, use the Arguments interface.
No need to copy again since in the set method you always replace with a new Map copy.
You can just keep a Set<ProgramRunId> for programRunsToStop.
It is better to list all program types instead of hardcoded to SERVICE.
All similar method should use program instead of service (e.g. stopProgram)

Please log with more context. E.g. "LOG.warn(Could not stop program {}. Will be retried", programId, ex).
Also, it should be logged as warning since it is not a fatal error and it will get retried.

These two lines can be combined as:
programRunsMap.computeIfAbsent(programId, k -> new ArrayList<>()).add(runtimeInfo);
Why need to load the run record? The runId has time encoded in it. You can simply order the runs by timestamp. See RunIds.getTime() method.
You don't need this. Just do a enabledProgramsMap.contains(programId) check

nodes.bodyText: I think the parent class expects the time returned is in milliseconds, while this interval is in seconds. You should do the conversion in the constructor. Generally it is good to carry the unit in the variable name. E.g. scheduleIntervalMillis.
